analysis: The documents primarily concern the delegation of presidential authority to various government officials and agencies. They outline specific powers and responsibilities that are transferred from the President to other individuals, such as Secretaries of departments, Under Secretaries, and Assistant Secretaries. The documents cover a range of topics, including employee performance, labor-management relations, military affairs, aviation, savings bonds, Interior Department functions, environmental policy, productivity improvement, Coast and Geodetic Survey, and wildlife protection. The sentiment is neutral and formal, focusing on the legal and administrative aspects of delegating authority.
title: Presidential Authority Delegations to Agencies
